transcript: what is vlan vlan is a virtual local area network one you can have multiple networks or vlans all on the same networking hardware or networking switch 2. traffic is still completely separated from vlan 1 and vlan 2 but it's done logically inside the switch rather than physically 3. vlans provide logical segmentation of networks the reason for using vlans is to avoid a physical separation of networks instead we can logically separate our multiple networks no matter where the client connections are on the network vlans give us the ability to allow or deny communication between devices and between networks iot devices or also known as internet of things devices can generally be less secure than most network attached devices still they require internet service to operate and allow you remote access for control and monitoring in an effort to better secure these devices from the rest of your network this is where a vlan can help navigate to the network tab within the peplink web administration click on the new land button and a new window will open in this example our primary untagged land is 10.5.1 point 1 and guestland is 10.10.10.1 for our iot network we'll use 10.10.20.1 along with the standard 255.255.255.0 24 subnet mask next give the network a name to identify it vlan id is going to be 3 in our case in ter vlan routing should be disabled so the devices cannot communicate with users or devices on other networks lastly set the dhcp range accordingly this is a range of addresses that the router picks from and hands out to each device that requests a network connection without this enabled you would need to manually assign ip information to each device if using dhcp you can use the default range of dot 10 to dot 250. although if you plan on connecting a small number of devices you may want to limit the range to the same amount we're going to use 10.10.20.10 to 10.10.20.15 here click save at the bottom then apply changes at the top right we have some wired and some wireless iot devices on our network so we're going to assign this vlan to a specific ethernet port as well as set up a new wi-fi ssid start at port settings on the left set port type to access set vlan to the eot network once again click save and apply changes now we'll set up the wi-fi access click on the ap tab then ssid enter a name to broadcast note that you can also disable the broadcast ssid setting for further security in this case you will need to manually enter the wi-fi information on each wireless iot device set vlan to the iot network we're also going to enable an advanced setting refer to the blue question mark here at the top and click on the link to show advanced settings find layer 2 isolation and check the box this is what isolates the devices within this one vland ssid to finish up we'll set a password as there is none defined by default change the security policy to wpa to personal and then shared key field will appear create a password between 8 and 63 characters long remember in this case sensitive we suggest clicking the hide characters button to confirm what you've entered once finished click save then up apply changes at this time you may need to refresh or reconnect any iot devices so that they obtain their new vlan address

snippet.title: Peplink/Pepwave: How to Use VLANs for IoT SECURITY
snippet.description:
We talk about what a VLAN is and What IoT means. How do you configure an IoT VLAN network? This can be helpful to personal and business users as it not only provides more security (by isolating devices and networks from each other), but allows you to control bandwidth to certain users/ devices as needed. 
https://5gstore.com/

transcript: what is vlan vlan is a virtual local area network one you can have multiple networks or vlans all on the same networking hardware or networking switch 2. traffic is still completely separated from vlan 1 and vlan 2 but it's done logically inside the switch rather than physically 3. vlans provide logical segmentation of networks the reason for using vlans is to avoid a physical separation of networks instead we can logically separate our multiple networks no matter where the client connections are on the network vlans give us the ability to allow or deny communication between devices and between networks now that you understand what a vlan is and how it can be used let's take a look at how we configure one for guest connections inside pepwave web administration start by going to the network tab within the peplink web administration the default ip address will be listed here as untagged lan make note of this as your guest vlan must be different click on the new lan button and a new window will open assuming your untagged lan is 192.168.50.1 you must at least change the 50 to a number between 1 and 254. in this example we'll use 192.12 and like most users we're going to leave the subnet mask at 255.255.255.0 24. next give your network a name to identify it the lan id will be too as this is our second network in ter vlan routing should be disabled so that users cannot communicate with users or devices on other networks now we need to set the dhcp range under the dhcp server section this is a range of addresses that the router picks from and hands out to each device that wants to connect to the network without dhcp enabled users could only connect if an address is manually assigned to their device click save at the bottom then apply changes at the top right to assign this vlan to a specific ethernet lan port for wired connections click port settings on the left set port type to access set vlan to the guest network you just created once again click save and apply changes at this time if you already have a device connected to the port you have just configured you may need to refresh its connection this can be done by simply disconnecting the ethernet cable then reconnecting it to the port if you need to allow guests to connect to wi-fi there's one more step for you to complete in our example here we have the max br1 classic which uses a built-in wi-fi access point click on the a p tab click ssid to configure the guest wi-fi access enter a name to broadcast for vlan select the guest network by default no password is configured change the security policy to wpa wpa2 personal and the shared key field will appear create a password between 8 and 63 characters long remember it is case sensitive we suggest clicking the hide characters button to confirm what you've entered then click save and apply changes give the router a moment to apply the changes in your devices to refresh their available wi-fi networks

transcript: this video is an overview of the pep wave max HD for cellular router first a quick hardware overview on the front you have your Wi-Fi antenna connections a USB port 8 LAN connections that rpoe capable and to individual LAN connections for Wired Internet sources moving along to the back of the router you have a number of different connections you've got your terminal block for power to AC inputs and a number of cellular and GPS antenna connections two Phillips screws hideaway the SIM card slots on the back of the router each modem has two sim card slots for a total of eight sims on the Macs HD four and a sim as your primary and V can be a backup connection for additional data or another carrier all of your cellular antennas are included with the HD four and screw onto the back of the router this is great for fixed locations however if this is going in a vehicle you might opt for a multi cable external antenna Wi-Fi antennas for the access point and Wi-Fi LAN function are also included because this can be a mobile router for an ambulance or a bus a GPS antenna is also included the max HD four comes in a number of variations including a European North American category six LTE advanced and new category 12 firstnet ready modem for more information on the max HD for our other cellular solutions contact the experts at 5g store.com

snippet.title: Pepwave MAX HD4, Now With Cat 6 LTE Advanced and Cat 12 FirstNet Cellular Modems
snippet.description:
https://5gstore.com/product/7263_pepwave_max_hd4.html

The Pepwave Max HD4 router gives enterprise users fast mobile networking speeds without needing to lease costly fiber optic lines. This rugged networking router has four embedded cellular modems for use with all major 3G/4G/LTE carriers. It also has two wired WAN and one USB external modem port along with Wi-Fi as WAN capabilities, giving businesses up to eight ISP connections. Automatic failover means your network will never go down because one provider does, as the router will immediately switch traffic over to healthy service(s). The Max HD4 Quad with MediaFast also has caching technology that reduces costs and network loads by retrieving content during off-peak hours

Let your router intelligently combine all active services using either load balancing or Pepwave’s SpeedFusion Bonding for faster data transfer speeds. Load balancing allows network administrators to prioritize connections so your company never has to worry about hitting data caps or using a less optimal provider. Bonding, on the other hand, gives your network military-grade VPN security and 100 percent uptime with a working WAN connection. Either option can be monitored anywhere using the cloud-based InControl 2 management system. With the dual long-range Wi-Fi radio, you can also make the Wi-Fi as WAN your incoming connect using remote access points.

Pepwave load balancing/bonding router models are available for the North American and European markets along with Cat6 Max HD4 routers that can be used in either region. Each one is made with industrial components and a metal enclosure that is certified to stand up to extreme temperatures and rough conditions. Built-in surge protection adds additional reliability for use in vehicles, surveillance and other tough applications. The included rack mount and optional card protector bracket will keep all components stable and secure. When you order the Max HD4 networking router at 5Gstore, you will receive a year of free technical support from our team of mobile broadband and networking experts.

transcript: hello this is Kevin with 3G store and today we're going to take a look at the 3G store SMS power switch taking a look at the hardware you have indicator lights power outlet power plug and SIM card slot and the other side of the unit has the power button and accessory connector the SMS power switch as its name implied is controlled by SMS messages aka text messages instead of an IP based solution where you must connect this to an existing network via ethernet or Wi-Fi the SMS switch works completely on its own the first thing we'll show you here is how you do its basic setup once you receive the unit the unit will come ready with a SIM card inserted and at a phone number which you will use to connect to the unit and send it messages the first message we'll send is pound zero zero pound when we send the message you'll see the indicator lights blink that it has received and is replying to the message on this phone on the right you'll then see the return command pound zero zero pound is the first set of command and it sets the master user and a password for the unit now we of course recommend setting a new password outside of the default but for our purposes we'll leave it there at this point you're ready to control the unit you can also add additional users if you need others to be able to control the switch remotely pound oh seven pound is the command for getting a general status from the switch you'll see the switch lights blink and then the text comes in almost immediately this text then shows you the master user number its status and its accessory status as well now we'll show you what the switch can do with remote commands we have the outlet connected to a lamp and currently the front outlet power is off sending a pound a one pound command to the SMS power switch will tell the unit to turn the front outlet on you'll see the lights blink and you'll see the lamp turn on the switch then reports back its current status pound oh two pound is the opposite command which will turn off the front power to the outlet this gives you quick easy remote control of a device without relying on any IP based technology no port forwarding or routers to configure just plug in the switch and you're ready to go another function of the SMS power switch is to alert you if power has been lost or restored removing power from the unit you'll see that it is still blinking it holds just enough power to be able to send out that text message and let you know that power has been lost the unit will also then report power on when the power is restored the switch will boot up connect to the cellular network and send you a text message as well this is just a small taste of what the SMS switch can do for you for more information visit 3g store calm less SMS switch and for more videos like this be sure to subscribe to our Channel thank you

transcript: hello my name is Kevin with 3G store and this is a look at load balancing routers if you did not watch our previous video on failover be sure to do that first as there are topics that will pertain to this video the first thing that we'll do is look at how a regular business gets their internet connection in this case we have a cable line coming into an ISP provided router from that router we then have our connected devices at the business life voice over IP phones internet connected TVs and guest devices on a Wi-Fi network the problem with a lot of these businesses is you don't have enough bandwidth to support the needs of all of your devices on the network so what's the solution that a lot of ISPs offer well they try to sell you on a dedicated fiber connection the problem is dedicated fiber costs a lot of money thousands of dollars to install and hundreds of dollars per month and you still have a single point of failure so what's the solution well that's where a load balancing router comes into play what you'll have is a router that supports two or more wired connections in this case we have a second cable connection from another ISP in the area we now have a router that has additional bandwidth and the traffic coming from all of our devices is split up we can create a outbound policy rule that says VoIP traffic routes over our low latency first connection and our slower second connection can be reserved for our backup devices and for our guest Network now what happens if one of those connections fails well that's where failover comes in in the instance that the first connection was to fail all of our traffic will then seamlessly switch over to the second cable connection if that connection was to fail this is where you then have a backup connection which is typically a high availability LTE connection you now have a network with multiple sources of bandwidth and then backup connectivity so you have the highest availability with the lowest monthly cost for more information on load balancing or to find out if it's right for your business contact the experts at 3g store or visit 3g store com you

The Pepwave Surf SOHO is a professional-grade Wi-Fi router designed for home office, small business, and power users. snippet.title: 3Gstore VoIP and PBX Failover Test Line - Failover vs SpeedFusion (Peplink and Pepwave)
snippet.description:
The 3Gstore Failover Test Line will test your failover router and how it handles VoIP traffic. Typical failover routers will leave you disconnected in the event of a primary connection failure, while SpeedFusion provides an always on unbreakable connection.

We are not showing the router used in the first half of the video. The purpose of the video is not to single out another manufacturer as this applies to ALL non SpeedFusion routers, rather this video is meant to educate people on the difference between standard failover and SpeedFusion bonding.

Call 866-347-8673 x611 to test your connection! Is your backup solution not what you thought? Is the disconnected during a failover not acceptable?

This is the NEW Surf SOHO MK3 with included antennas and 802.11ac wireless AC support!

Fast Facts About This Product:

This router is best for: Home and small office users who want to take advantage of many of Pepwave's popular features (including bandwidth monitoring and PPTP support) but don't need a full-fledged enterprise router.

Internet Connections Supported: 1 Wired WAN, 1 USB (view full compatibility chart), WiFi as WAN* (more info)

snippet.title: Peplink MAX HD4 - Cellular Load Balancing and SpeedFusion Bonding
snippet.description:
http://3gstore.com/product/6042_pepwave_max_hd4.html

This router features four embedded modems and you will need SIM cards with active service from a compatible provider to use them. The HD4 has standard 2FF SIM slots - if you plan to use a micro or nano SIM, you'll need a SIM adapter.

3Gstore is a Peplink Certified Partner

Fast Facts About This Product:

This router is best for: Enterprise users wanting to load balance and/or aggregate between several wireless internet connections and want a solution with embedded/integrated Verizon and AT&T 3G/4G modems (aggregation/bonding requires the Max HD4 and a Balance 210 or higher router, or SimplyBonding from 3Gstore).

http://3gstore.com/product/5248_simply_bonding.html

Internet Connections Supported: 4 Embedded 3G/4G, 2 Wired WAN, 1 USB (view full compatibility chart), WiFi as WAN* (more info)
Networks Supported for Embedded Modems: 4G LTE (B2/1900, B4/AWS (XLTE), B5/850, B13/700, B17/700, B25/1900), WCDMA/HSDPA/HSUPA/HSPA+/DC-HSPA+ (B1/2100, B2/1900, B4/AWS, B5/850, B8/900), EV-DO Rev.A (BC0/800, BC1/1900, BC10/800)

WiFi Standard: 802.11 B, G, N; 2.4GHz and 5.0GHz (concurrent)
WiFi Range: 300-400' through walls, much greater unobstructed (variable depending on interference from other electronics and physical interference such as walls and ceilings)
Ethernet ports: 8 GbE LAN + 2 GbE WAN
Size: 1.9" x 11.5" x 6.9"

Bonding: SpeedFusion VPN Bonding. NOTE: Many factors influence the real-world throughput you'll see from bonded connections, including latency, connection type, connection speeds, traffic type, and reliability on both sides of the SpeedFusion tunnel. Cellular users should note that bonded cellular connections suffer from "flow control" of TCP traffic at the carrier level, and 3Gstore cannot guarantee that bonding multiple cellular connections will result in faster speeds (however, the other benefits of SpeedFusion remain, such as unbreakable VPN, session persistence, and 100% up-time as long as you have 1 healthy WAN).

Many mobile Internet options are available today, including 3G/4G cellular, Wi-Fi, Satellite, WiMAX, LTE, and many more. However, coverage and speeds vary drastically between providers and locations. The Pepwave MAX allows you to combine multiple wireless Internet connections and intelligently manages them to accommodate the changing environment. Everything is automatic. You can stay connected and productive.

Our unique modular approach gives you the freedom to choose exactly what Internet services are the best fit for your area. Unlike other mobile routers the MAX doesn't force you to use one technology or provider - you can combine the benefits of up to six connections. You have the freedom to connect to whatever provider or technology makes sense for your application. Need more bandwidth? Add another connection. Coverage poor in some areas? Add another provider. The MAX intelligently manages all connections to give you the best experience possible.

snippet.title: Remote Power IP Switch - International Power
snippet.description:
International IP Switch - http://3gstore.com/product/6653_2_outlet_ip_switch_international_power.html

US IP Switch - http://3gstore.com/product/6081_2_outlet_ip_switch.html

The 3Gstore IP Power Switch is a simple product that automatically power-cycles any device when internet connectivity is lost. All you have to do is connect the included ethernet cable from the 3Gstore IP Switch to your router, and then connect the power cables of the devices that you want to be power-cycled when internet connectivity is lost, like your DSL modem and router. Once you have everything connected, press the "UIS" button, and everything will be up and running. The 3Gstore IP Switch automatically pings five different targets (which you can specify), and when it is unable to ping the specified targets, it will power-cycle any devices that are connected to its power source.

Uses for the 3Gstore IP Switch:

Home users who have to manually power-cycle their router to re-gain internet connectivity 
IT Professionals who need to automatically or remotely reset devices
Preventing your connection from timing out or going dormant
Create an automatic power schedule (ex: turn on at 9am & turn off at 5pm)

Fast Facts about this Product:
This repeater kit is best for: Verizon users looking for an easily-installed, powerful signal booster for areas up 13,000 square feet without needing to run cable or mount antennas outside.

Coverage area*: up to 13,000 square feet

All-in-One Kit? YES

Compatibility: This amplifier supports VoLTE (voice over LTE), 4G LTE and 4G XLTE for Verizon only. It is NOT compatible or approved for use with ANY other carrier.

Key Features:
Cel-Fi doesn't require the installation of external antennas, bulky coaxial cables, handset registration, or a configuration setup by the user. In fact, Cel-Fi intelligently and automatically senses and adapts to its environment-including to changes made by your carrier, or to changes caused by nearby equipment like Wi-Fi, or other Cel-Fi devices.

Cel-Fi provides coverage up to 13,000 sq. ft., making it ideal for large homes and offices. Multiple Units of Cel-Fi can be deployed in large offices and will not interfere with coverage strength.

Cel-Fi is radically different from traditional repeaters, Cel-Fi is the only intelligent booster that's wireless-in/wireless-out. The Network Unit receives the signal from the mobile network (it requires as little as one bar of signal, or -104 dBm RSCP, and -120 dBm RSRP) and relays it wirelessly to the Coverage Unit that amplifies it for up to 100dB of gain.

snippet.title: Cel-Fi PRO for AT&T - Improve Signal Strength to Security System Cellular Backup
snippet.description:
http://3gstore.com/product/6588_cel-fi_pro_signal_booster_for_att_3g_4g_4g_lte.html

If you have an ADT alarm system for your home or business, there is a chance you also have a Safewatch Cellguard cellular backup system in place. This device is a white box with a cellular antenna that acts as a backup connection to your primary internet connection. If your primary internet connection fails, the Cellguard system takes over and runs your alarm over a cellular network.

Everybody understands the importance of having an alarm system, and the benefits of the Safewatch Cellguard are many. The device works in the event of a power outage, lets your alarms function when your ISP is down or experiencing network issues, doesn’t rely on any phone lines, and gives you peace of mind that you’ll be protected 24/7. Something that many people overlook is the cellular signal available where the Cellguard will be installed. A cellular backup is great, but if there isn’t adequate signal available, how can it protect you?

Enter the Cel-Fi PRO Signal Booster for AT&T. The Cel-Fi does away with all the complicated setup, issues, and installation costs of typical signal boosters. No mounting antennas to the roof, running cables through walls and ceilings, and no unsightly panel or dome antennas on the walls and ceilings. Instead the Cel-Fi PRO has just two pieces of hardware, a Network Unit (NU) and a Coverage Unit (CU). Installation is as simple as placing the NU in a window where the AT&T signal is the strongest and connecting it to power. The CU is then placed elsewhere in the home or office and connected to power. The NU picks up and amplifies the AT&T signal, wirelessly sends the signal to the CU, and the CU pushes out an amplified cellular signal for any devices in range. It is that simple!

The Cel-Fi PRO will do double duty for you. First it will ensure your Safewatch Cellguard has a strong connection to the cellular network. This means your backup connection for your ADT alarm will be working for you 24/7. Even if it is installed in the center of a brick or metal building, it can be in the reach of the Cel-Fi. Because the Cel-Fi PRO covers up to 13,000 square feet there are very few places it can’t work for you. The second the job the Cel-Fi does of course is to boost the AT&T signal to other devices. AT&T phones, hotspots, and modems, along with the Cellguard, all benefit from an improved cellular signal.

The Cel-Fi PRO isn’t limited to working with just ADT systems either. Any alarm system that uses the AT&T 3G, 4G, or 4G LTE network, can take advantage of a simple, zero installation way to boost the signal and provide the peace of mind knowing that your alarm system is working for you all the time.

snippet.title: Long Range Invisible Ethernet Bridge Kit Demonstration
snippet.description:
The Long Range Invisible Ethernet Kit is a point-to-point antenna system that allows you to wirelessly extend a network from one location to another location up to one mile away. It consists of two antennas: one installed at the primary location connected to the LAN of the existing network, and a second at the secondary location to pick up the signal and feed it into a network switch, router, computer, camera, etc (whatever you need to provide internet to!). The kit comes pre-configured, so no difficult setup or networking knowledge is required. Just mount the two antennas using the included hardware, aim them at each other, and connect them to their respective devices!

http://3Gstore.com/bridgekit

snippet.title: Cradlepoint Cor IBR350 4G LTE Gateway Unboxing
snippet.description:
The Cradlepoint COR IBR350 series is a low cost, extremely compact, and high performing 4G LTE gateway designed for the M2M market. Applications like ATMs, digital signs, kiosks, and other mission critical deployments are a perfect fit for this new hardware. The COR IBR350 is a lower cost alternative to its big brother, the COR IBR600/650 series. The “50” part of its name indicates there is no onboard WiFi, which isn’t required for its target uses in the M2M space. The IBR350 has a single LAN port for connecting to a device like an ATM or Kiosk. 

 Major Features

-Cloud Management with Cradlepoint ECM (Enterprise Cloud Manager)

ECM allows customers to easily manage multiple Cradlepoint routers across their network from one central Cloud-based portal. This can save admins time with firmware updates and applying custom configurations and also allows reports to be generated with a variety of different filters. In addition to these features, admins can also create sub-accounts with varying levels of access for technicians and other administrators. Remotely monitor devices, their uptime, data usage, and more from a single cloud based login.

-Integrated Verizon 4G LTE Modem with XLTE Support

The embedded modem of the IBR350 is LTE ONLY. As cellular carriers move from 3G technology to more LTE coverage, there is less and less need for that backwards compatibility. Since M2M devices rarely are moved or relocated, as long as there is an LTE signal to work with from the start, there is no need to have 3G capability at all.

For more information visit http://3gstore.com/product/5993_cradlepoint_m2m-iot-cor-ibr350.html

This LTE only hotspot can be used in a number of conditions with its long life internal battery. This is LTE ONLY so in some cases you may need an external antenna. You can improve the signal strength in weak coverage areas, or improve the signal in buildings where you may have interference or thick walls and metal interfering.

snippet.title: weBoost Drive 4G-S
snippet.description:
The weBoost Drive 4G-S cellular signal booster is a simple, effective solution to maintain effortless communication in your vehicle. It’s designed to work with all smartphones and virtually any other cell phone. weBoost improves your coverage—including 4G—no matter your cellular carrier in the United States and Canada. When your phone is placed in the convenient booster cradle, the Drive 4G-S will amplify the cellular signal, providing the coverage you deserve for essential voice and data connections. Installation is simple – no tools required. All you do is connect a small magnetic antenna outside your car to the booster cradle, which will provide your phone with the strongest, most reliable signal possible.

How it works: The magnetic mount antenna picks up the cellular signal and sends it through the cable to the cradle amplifier. The signal is then boosted and pushed out to the phone or device sitting in the cradle.

For more information visit http://3gstore.com/product/5656_weboost-drive-4gs-cell-phone-hotspot-signal-booster-470107.html

For more information about the Wilson Electronics/weBoost naming https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pgS-h09c5xU&list=UUPfPFshSC-rH4IbaClXrWSQ

snippet.title: ClearRF Direct Connect M2M Amplifier with Passive Bypass
snippet.description:
ClearRF’s patented Passive Bypass Technology is a Fail-Safe feature that allows an ambient cell signal to pass-through the booster to the connected cellular device…even if the booster loses power or fails. Competitors' M2M boosters do not have this technology, which means that when the booster loses power or fails, your entire M2M system “shuts down”. That is a bad scenario if your M2M application is mission-critical and is required to remain on-line for safety, security & liability reasons!

Features:
    Patented Passive Bypass Technology
    Patented Auto Gain & Oscillation Control
    15dB gain Bi-Directional Signal Booster
    Simple plug & play Direct Connect Device
    Power Ranges from 8.0 to 36.0 VDC
    FCC & IC Type Accepted

For more information visit http://3gstore.com/product/5997_clearrf_m2m_cellular_signal_amplifier.html

snippet.title: Panorama Portable MiMo Antenna for 3G/4G Devices
snippet.description:
Panorama’s DMM antenna contains two separate 3G/4G antennas in one compact antenna housing. It is typically used with routers/gateways that have embedded cellular modules and is NOT recommended for use with traditional aircards (USB modems, hotspots, etc).

This SMA/Male version of the Panorama LTE/Mobile Broadband Portable MiMo Antenna (DMM-7-27) is the perfect solution for portable use where a fixed mount antenna is not possible. The stylish form hides a powerful and effective antenna designed to significantly improve signal strength and transfer speeds for data connections. The DMM-7-27 Supports MiMo & Diversity across 2G/3G/4G platforms. The antenna comes with fold out feet, suction cups and clips for various mounting options.

For more information visit http://3gstore.com/product/5994_panorama-wideband-mimo-3g-4g-antenna.html

snippet.title: Cradlepoint COR IBR350 4G LTE Gateway
snippet.description:
The Cradlepoint COR IBR350 series is a low cost, extremely compact, and high performing 4G LTE gateway designed for the M2M market. Applications like ATMs, digital signs, kiosks, and other mission critical deployments are a perfect fit for this new hardware. The COR IBR350 is a lower cost alternative to its big brother, the COR IBR600/650 series. The “50” part of its name indicates there is no onboard WiFi, which isn’t required for its target uses in the M2M space. The IBR350 has a single LAN port for connecting to a device like an ATM or Kiosk. 

 Major Features

-Cloud Management with Cradlepoint ECM (Enterprise Cloud Manager)

ECM allows customers to easily manage multiple Cradlepoint routers across their network from one central Cloud-based portal. This can save admins time with firmware updates and applying custom configurations and also allows reports to be generated with a variety of different filters. In addition to these features, admins can also create sub-accounts with varying levels of access for technicians and other administrators. Remotely monitor devices, their uptime, data usage, and more from a single cloud based login.

-Integrated Verizon 4G LTE Modem with XLTE Support

The embedded modem of the IBR350 is LTE ONLY. As cellular carriers move from 3G technology to more LTE coverage, there is less and less need for that backwards compatibility. Since M2M devices rarely are moved or relocated, as long as there is an LTE signal to work with from the start, there is no need to have 3G capability at all.

For more information visit http://3gstore.com/product/5993_cradlepoint_m2m-iot-cor-ibr350.html

snippet.title: weBoost Amplifiers Introduction
snippet.description:
With the start of the new year comes some exciting news from Wilson Electronics: the launch of a new line of amplifiers under the brand weBoost. The weBoost lineup includes products for a variety of applications, from vehicle boosters to kits for the home to powerful options for large homes and offices.

For more information visit http://3Gstore.com/weboost

snippet.title: 2 Outlet IP Switch Advanced Ping Settings
snippet.description:
The 2 Outlet Remote Power IP Switch is a versatile tool for any IT situation. With the ability to automatically reset devices when internet connectivity is lost, schedule power cycles, and prevent truck rolls for simple hardware reboots, there isn’t a situation where this won’t save you time and money.

What if you are in a situation where you have a modem and separate router, and want to monitor them individually? Many 3Gstore customers have been in the situation where they have a rock solid router that doesn’t need to be reset normally, and a modem that fails often. Simply letting the IP Switch power cycle both on an internet failure is an option, but that can mean unnecessary local downtime if its just the modem that has failed. Simply not plugging the routers power into the IP Switch means just the modem would reset, but what if the router does lock up, and there is nobody there to reset it? Equipment on the LAN would be without communication. This could be a camera and DVR, or any other device that doesn’t need an internet connection to function. Below are the steps to configure the 2 Outlet IP Switch to fix that problem.

For more information and links to alternative ways to locate the IP Switch on your network, visit our full article on EVDOinfo: http://www.evdoinfo.com/content/view/4972/64/

For more information or to contact the experts at 3Gstore, visit http://3Gstore.com/ipswitch

snippet.title: 3Gstore All IP Switch Comparison
snippet.description:
The 3Gstore IP Power Switch is a simple product that automatically power-cycles any device when internet connectivity is lost. All you have to do is connect the included ethernet cable from the 3Gstore IP Switch to your router, and then connect the power cables of the devices that you want to be power-cycled when internet connectivity is lost, like your DSL modem and router. The 3Gstore IP Switch automatically pings five different targets (which you can specify), and when it is unable to ping the specified targets, it will power-cycle any devices that are connected to its power source.

iBoot® will save you time and money by reducing costly downtime. Just point your browser to the iBoot®, login and you are one click away from bringing that failed system back to life. iBoot® will even detect failed systems and take immediate action.
The iBoot G2+ is identical to the iBoot G2, with the addition of these advanced features:
    AutoPing Network Monitoring
    Graceful Shutdown
    Expansion to up to Three Outlets (with Expansion Unit - sold separately)
    External I/O for status monitoring

For more information on all the IP Switches visit http://3gstore.com/products/39_ip_switches.html

snippet.title: How to Connect the Pepwave Surf SOHO using WIFi as WAN
snippet.description:
The Pepwave Surf SOHO is a professional-grade Wi-Fi router designed for home office, small business, and power users. With support for 4G LTE/3G, cable, DSL, and other broadband connections, the Surf SOHO makes it possible to deploy fast and secure 802.11abgn Wi-Fi hotspots anywhere. The Surf SOHO also features built-in long-range and optional external antennas, business-class VPN, cellular usage monitoring, and URL blocking, making it an ideal networking solution for a wide range of mobile and office uses.

WiFi as WAN (WAW) means that the router or bridge can pick up the WiFi signal from an external source (for example, campground WiFi at an RV park, free WiFi at McDonald's, or even the hotspot feature from a smartphone like the iPhone or Android Phone) and create a new secure, private network from it. In other words, the router or bridge is using the external WiFi network as the internet source instead of utilizing a wired connection like cable or DSL or a cellular connection like a 3G or 4G USB modem.

Even if you have your own cable, DSL, 3G or 4G internet connection, WAW can come in VERY handy.

For more information visit http://3Gstore.com/surfsoho

snippet.title: AP One AC Mini  - Overview and Speed Test
snippet.description:
The Pepwave AP One AC Mini comes equipped with a full set of enterprise features and will work instantly with your Peplink Balance router (it can be used with any other router, too, but the full-feature set will only be available when used with other Peplink/Pepwave products). snippet.title: A Custom Appearance For Your SSID
snippet.description:
A quick tutorial on how you can change the appearance of your SSID, or wireless network name, using Unicode text.

This works on nearly all routers. You just need some Unicode to copy and paste into your router settings and you are done!

snippet.title: SimplyBonding Live Demonstration
snippet.description:
SimplyBonding is a hosting service that allows you to bond multiple internet connections into one super fast, super reliable, unbreakable connection with minimal equipment. Unlike failover or load balancing, a bonded connection takes multiple internet connections and COMBINES them. snippet.title: Peplink High Availability Mode - VRRP
snippet.description:
Peplink routers have an impressive track record for long up time and reliability. Did you know that certain routers from Peplink offer a High Availability (HA) mode? HA mode is built on VRRP, or Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol. This is essentially hardware failover. You run two identical Peplink routers where you would normally install just one. In the event of a power outage or catastrophic failure, the second router will take over the responsibility of running your network and keeping your business online.

For more information contact the experts at 3Gstore

http://3gstore.com/peplink

snippet.title: SimplyBonding Unbreakable Internet
snippet.description:
What is it? - SimplyBonding is a hosting service that allows you to bond multiple internet connections into one super fast, super reliable, unbreakable connection with minimal equipment. Unlike failover or load balancing, a bonded connection takes multiple internet connections and COMBINES them. If you have 3 internet connections that are bonded together and one goes down, your connected devices and apps will never know there was a failure - even apps that maintain persistent connections!

How does it work? - SimplyBonding uses Peplink's Speedfusion technology to bond multiple 3G, 4G, DSL, or cable connections into one fast/reliable/unbreakable connection. Utilizing Speedfusion typically requires a Peplink router on both ends of the connection - one at the location where you need the bonded connection, and another at another location with a high-speed internet connection to bond the connections and send the data back to the primary location via VPN. SimplyBonding eliminates the need for this dual-router setup. SimplyBonding requires just ONE router, which will be configured to connect to our hosted service - WE handle the bonding and VPN for you!

For more information on how you can get online with unbreakable, always on connectivity, contact us at the links below!

http://www.SimplyBonding.com
http://3Gstore.com/simplybonding

snippet.title: FusionHub Introduction
snippet.description:
An introduction to FusionHub, the new SpeedFusion Virtual Appliance from Peplink. With the ability to run a centralized, cloud based FusionHub, the possibilities are endless. 

Save money by dropping high cost fiber or leased lines and replace them with bonded DSL and Cable connections. 
Improve up-time by using multiple WAN links instead of a single point of failure. 
Create a central location for VPN connectivity across a corporate network, reducing setup time and linking offices like they were connected by a long ethernet cord. 
Combine the bandwidth of multiple WAN connections for video streaming or uploading large files uninterrupted.
Manage an entire corporate network from a single cloud, InControl2.

For more information visit http://3Gstore.com/fusionhub and http://3gstore.com/page/145_peplink_fusionhub.html

transcript: hello this is Kevin with 3G store and today I'm going to show you a simple way to improve campground Wi-Fi using Wi-Fi as when let's say that you're staying at the 3G store campground all the way back here free Wi-Fi is offered for all of the guests but the access point is not powerful enough to reach you a Wi-Fi is when device will not only help you pick up that signal but it will also let you create a secure network of your own here are just a few of the options first is the pep wave surf on the go and the pep wave device connector the surf on the go is very small and compact and perfect for travel on the back it has an antenna that is meant for picking up and receiving Wi-Fi there is power and Ethernet there is also a USB port for a cellular modem of Wi-Fi is not available estimated range of the surf on the go is about a hundred and fifty feet the larger option is the pap wave device connector around the back you have the same type of connections including your power and your Ethernet however there is no backup connection for your cellular modem range on the device connector is much larger - about a thousand feet or so so now you have two different options with two different ranges with a little bit different feature set what if you need a little bit more range though the Wi-Fi antennas on the back of the surf on the going device connector are removable you can use a larger external Wi-Fi antenna like this nine and a half inch full band on the bottom of this it has a connector where you'll be attaching cable and then a mounting plate for putting on the outside of an RV on either a pole or a ladder all you'll need to do is remove the existing antenna from the device connector or surf on the go and use a proper cable and adapter you'll be mounting the device connector on the inside of your RV running a cable outside and connecting the antenna from there you have a larger antenna that is higher gain and is free of any interference from the rest of your RV other antenna options exist as well like this smaller phantom antenna instead of bolting or clipping to the side of your RV this is going to mount directly through the roof if you want to keep your antenna low-profile but still maximize your Wi-Fi reach this might be the setup for you for more information visit 3g store comm and for more videos like this be sure to subscribe to our Channel

snippet.title: Pepwave Device Connector - Setup and Use
snippet.description:
A look at the Pepwave Device Connector and how easy it is to setup. This can be used in two ways. First, the DC is a very powerful access point with indoor ranges of up to 1000', much greater unobstructed. Simply connect by ethernet into your network, and your existing router can manage this, and anybody connected to the WiFi of the DC will be on the same network as your original router. Second, you can use this is a WiFi repeater or range extender. The DC can pickup a WiFi signal and use it as a source of internet, at the same time it will repeat either the same network or a new SSID and password of your choice. This is known as WiFI as WAN. Great for anybody looking to wirelessly extend range, RV parks, home owners, businesses, etc!

For more information visit http://3Gstore.com/deviceconnector

is what is Pep VPN pep VPN is built upon the same engine that is used by speed Fusion's Wan bonding technology it's a device to device VPN protocol that's extremely easy to set up and configure it provides a full 256 bit AES encryption and is compatible with existing speed Fusion Hardware this will now be available on all single active Wan devices from peplink to give you a real world example of how you can use pep VPN say we have a balance 380 in the primary office and we're using a pep VPN enabled Max br1 in the remote location using pep VPN we have a very simple way to configure two remote networks to speak to each other and to share network resources remotely setting up a speed Fusion enabled device to communicate with a pepep VPN enabled device is very easy the first thing we're going to do is look at our balance 380 and how to set that up so the first thing you'll do is go up and click on network and on the left hand side select the speed Fusion option you can see that we currently don't have any VPN connections or profiles to find in there so we'll do that in just a second first thing we need to do though is look at our local ID and make sure we have that set properly the local ID is used with speed fusion and pep VPN in order for the two networks to communicate with each other on our speed Fusion box we have the local ID set to London so we're going to have to enter that on the br1 side without the local ID enabled on each side of the pep VPN or speed Fusion tunnel the VPN will never be able to establish so now we're going to go ahead and set up a VPN profile back to our connection in New York which is the br1 we looked at earlier we're going to click on new profile and every profile is going to require a name so you'll have to set this up on both the 380 and the br1 we're going to call this New York office since that's the name of the network we're going to connect back to this is active and set to 256 AES encryption by default remote ID is going to be the local ID of the network you're trying to connect to so we're going to enter the local ID of the Max br1 and that is set as New York pre-shared key is an optional field in the pep VPN and speed Fusion connection essentially this would be a passphrase that you'd have to enter each location for an added level of security so it's more than just the remote ID that you need to connect by the next field is for remote IP addresses host names this is going to be where you fill in the IP address of the network you're going to be connecting to this only has to be filled in on one set of the device because pep VPN and speed Fusion will communicate the other network name back for you the other option you have is for a data Port we're going to leave that at default but if you know that a specific Port is blocked by your carrier you can switch all of your speed fusion and pep VPN traffic to a specific port number the other options for w connection priority apply to the speed Fusion device since it has multiple Wan links we have all of these set for Priority One highest right now but if we only wanted to use specific connections on our VPN tunnel we could switch them by priority once everything is configured the next step is to click save and in the top right hand corner click apply changes now that the balance 380 has been set up the next step is to take and open our Max br1 and set up the pep VPN profile there this is located under Advanced and pep VPN n you'll notice that under pvpn the local ID is set for New York that is what we just entered in on the balance 380 so now just like on the 380 we have to create a profile when we open this up it's going to ask us for a name so we're going to make this very simple and just call this London office it's going to be active with the 256bit AES encryption the remote ID on the balance 380 we set is where we're going to enter that here so that is London and the next part is remote IP addresses remember this says optional but you do have to enter that on at least one side of your pep VPN connection I already have this on my clipboard so I'll paste it in there remember we're connecting to a speed Fusion enabled device so they actually have two w links on the 380 side we can go ahead and enter both of those IP addresses however it is unnecessary pep VPN will establish the connection with a single IP address and once that connection is made multiple connections will be made back from the balance 380 on all the available Wan links this means if one of the IP addresses was to go down we'll have an unbreakable connection to our VPN The Next Step just like on the 380 is to click save and then apply changes in the top right to create the profile back on the dashboard of the max br1 we can see that it is applying the changes that we just made pep VPN now shows up with the London office profile we just created now that the VPN profile has been applied you can see it is switched to creating tunnel creating tunnel means the br1 has reached out and communicated with the balance 380 and it is establishing the VPN once creating tunnel is finished it will switch to updating routes this means the remaining W links from the balance 380 are being communicated to the br1 zooming in now you can see the pep VPN profile we just set up on the br1 says established that means that we have entered in all the correct IP information and the correct local ID to establish the VPN switching over to the balance 380 that we first looked at our profile we created through speed Fusion says established as well and the padlock signifies that we are encrypted through 256bit AES to look at some information about our pep VPN connection that we just established you'll click on the status button the profile for London office shows up and it tells you the IP of the remote Network that you're communicating with when you click on the blue arrow it will tell you which links we have active on our br1 and the red and green lights signify which links are actually connected to the speed Fusion or other pep VPN profile going back to the balance 380 and looking at the status we can bring that up pull up the profile that we set up for our New York office we can see the remote Network that we're connected to and which links are active in the profile now being a speed Fusion capable device there's multiple W links and they each have a green light meaning we have multiple VPN tunnels back to the br1 for failover now we demonstrated this today with a speed Fusion enabled balance router connecting to a br1 with pep VPN you can also set this up by hooking two pep VPN devices directly to each other the benefit to using a speed Fusion device at your primary location and deploying multiple pep VPN only devices in the field is if one of the WAN connections at the main office goes down there's still multiple VPN tunnels talking to each of the pep VPN devices this way there's an transmit data across the open Internet let's say we have our phone and computer and we're browsing the internet at the local coffee shop through their free Wi-Fi if we want to securely transmit data say to online banking we can connect to the home PPTP server now any information that we send a receive is going to be encapsulated and transmitted securely from the coffee shop Wi-Fi through the open internet back to our surf Soho this protects us for any potential threats on the coffee shop Wi-Fi network and it also lets us take advantage of the Soho's firewall while away from home setting up transcript: hello this is matt with 3g store and today we're going to talk about surveillance and ip cameras there's a large demand for this for a lot of customers that have vacation homes doing remote surveillance where your only connectivity is 3g or 4g cellular now it's important to understand that various carriers have different stipulations that you must be aware of in order for the solutions that you see on the bottom of our page to actually work so first off we'll start with verizon verizon technically has two networks right now they have their 3g network which is cdma-based and their 4g lte network which is their long-term evolution now on the 3g network a 3g only data device will assign a public facing ip this means it's publicly routable but it is dynamic so every time the device reboots or you disconnect reconnect you will have a new ip address so you can use dynamic hosting which is essentially a central server which updates your ip address so instead of entering your ip address in whichever port to get to your ip camera all you need to do is enter the dynamic host that you create through dyn dns or no ip as a few examples so that's on the 3g network so any type of ip cameras will work for that when you get into the 4g lte network they use ipv6 and essentially not the connection verizon assigns a private 10 dot address and if you connect the data card or using one of our embedded solutions you'll notice that the internal ip is a 10 dot address however if you go to ipchicken.com or do an ipconfig you'll see that the true ip out to the internet is different than what's in the router itself which means that port forwarding does not work now your option for this is to contact verizon and pay a one-time 500 fee that 500 fee gives you static ips for up to 500 devices so in other words you pay 500 once if you add 10 devices down the road on the same account you don't pay 500 dollars for the 10 additional devices those devices are encompassed within your verizon account and will automatically get assigned static ips after you contact their support staff so next up is sprint sprint is one of the only carriers that actually still offer a public facing ip on their three and four g networks you can purchase a static ip their static ip is three dollars per month per device so if you're only using a handful of devices it is more cost effective however if you're doing a mass scale deployment verizon with the one-time 500 fee might make more sense or with sprint as i said you get the public-facing ip so you can use dynamic hosting as a option as well so moving along at t is another popular choice the att network does block ports on either their 3g network or their 4g lte network so in order to go with att to port forward to any of your camera systems you will need to contact their sales staff and get an i2 gold account the i2 gold account is three dollars a month and that allows you to provision the device with the static ip which that will then allow port forwarding for you even though their 3g network does give a public facing ip the fact that they block the specific ports that you need means the dynamic hosting will not work it's mandatory that you have an i2gold account with a t next up our data jack prepaid service that uses a public-facing ip just like the sprint network that means that you're able to allow dynamic hosting to work however there is no option for a static ip so that's a brief intro on the various carriers when referring to the solutions below remember that all the routers that you see do offer dynamic host so you can utilize the 3g network just be aware that on the 4g lte networks you're getting the private 10. address which is non-routable so the only options are to get the static ip addresses for your accounts or you can look at the 3g store cloud cams which are a cloud-based ip camera system on both indoor pan tilt and outdoor solutions and they actually send the information to a central server which serves as the relay point so you can get your video feed on any ios android pc or there is a mac beta that's in development right now if you have more questions about snippet.title: Gaming Bandwidth Usage and MW3 - Monitored by Pepwave Routing Hardware
snippet.description:
This shows the misconception about gaming requiring a lot of bandwidth to play. In this hour long test we found Modern Warfare 3 used slightly less than 30MB playing Ground War with 18 people. For users using 3G or 4G connection this breaks down like this:

5GB account = 170 hours @ 30MB/hr
10GB account = 340 hours @ 30MB/hr

This does not factor in game patches, downloadable content or other web usage. Different games will use different amounts of data. To track your data consumption we recommend Peplink/Pepwave products found here - http://3gstore.com/peplink

Cradlepoint routers on 3.3.0 firmware or above do have basic bandwidth tracking features, however, you won't be able to track daily,weekly or monthly usage logs by separating each device on your network - http://3gstore.com/cradlepoint

snippet.title: Verizon LTE 4G Gaming on PS3 With a Cradlepoint Router

Other popular 3G/4G routers are the MBR95 ( http://3gstore.com/mbr95 ) CBR400 ( http://3gstore.com/cbr400 ), MBR1000 ( http://3gstore.com/mbr1000), MBR1200 ( http://3gstore.com/mbr1200 ) and MBR1400 ( http://3gstore.com/mbr1400 ).

transcript: hello this is maureen at 3g store and welcome to this week's beginner's corner today we're going to be talking about wireless repeaters now most people are familiar with standard antennas that you can use to directly connect to an antenna port on an air card or some phones even have antenna parts but what do you do if you have a device like the my5 that doesn't have an antenna port or phone like the iphone again no antenna port or you have a bunch of cellular devices that you want to provide a signal boost to the answer there is a wireless repeater now what a wireless repeater is it's simply a wireless amplifier and two antennas those are the basics of a repeater setup one antenna connected to one side of the amplifier preferably mounted outside where signal is better draws in the signal the amplifier boosts it and then a second antenna connected to the other side of the amplifier re-broadcast that boosted signal and then all of your cellular devices within range of that second antenna can benefit from the boosted signal even though none of them are actually physically connected to an antenna so for example an rv antenna like this this is a common choice for rvers it's about an 18 inch tall antenna and it can be directly connected to a device or it can be connected to one side of an amplifier like this and then a second antenna here's a couple options for the rebroadcasting antenna this is a little desktop antenna that just sits right on top of a desk like that this is called a panel antenna it would be mounted to a wall that would connect to the other side of the wireless repeater and that's what's rebroadcasting the boosted signal so it's really not as complicated as you might think and the three basic pieces that you need are the exterior antenna the amplifier itself and the rebroadcasting interior antenna as well of course has all the cabling repeater systems are a little trickier to set up than a traditional antenna with a booster antenna for example you just plug it straight into the antenna port on your air card and you're all set with the repeater system you also need to keep in mind separation between the external antenna and the internal rebroadcasting antenna if these two antennas are too close together they're going to cause some oscillations of interference which will cause the repeater to shut down and not work at all so you need to be mindful when you're setting up a repeater that your interior and your exterior antennas are spaced far enough apart now most of the repeater kits that include everything together come with ample cable to keep everything separated but if you're going to buy all the pieces individually you'll need to make sure that you're getting long enough cables to keep things far enough apart now one of the most common questions that we hear at 3g store about repeaters is how large of an area can this provide a signal boost to is this going to boost the signal in my entire home or office or am i going to have to be you know talking inches away from this interior antenna here now the answer to that question is a tricky one because there's a lot of factors that influence the range of a repeater setup the power of the amplifier itself uh can influence it the exterior antenna and where you have it mounted in fro influences the range and the interior antenna also influences the range for example an exterior antenna mounted on the outside of the building where signal is better i will provide a better signal and thus a better range if signal is very poor to begin with the range is going to be a lot smaller you're going to have to be closer to that interior antenna the interior antenna itself also makes a difference for example this panel antenna is made to cover about a room or two this little desktop antenna on the other hand is more for literally a desk area or you know maybe an rv for example the amplifier itself as i was saying also makes a difference a higher powered amplifier like this soho which is a small home and office amplifier is capable of providing a boost to a larger area amplifiers that are made for vehicles you're going to have to be much closer to that interior antenna and that's simply the way they're made since they're made for a vehicle the manufacturers are assuming that you'll be a little bit closer to it now there are quite a few options these few items that i'm showing right here are the you know just a few basic options you could spend as little as a couple hundred dollars for a repeater set up you could spend as much as seven or eight hundred dollars the difference in all the pricing depends on the equipment that you're getting are you getting a system to provide a boost just to one small area like your car or if you're trying to boost the signal to you know a two-story house for example so what i recommend doing to start is go to 3gstore.com repeaters that's a little frequently asked questions page it's got a lot of great basic info on repeaters and and if you want to check out the actual repeater kits themselves if you think you're ready to venture into that you can go to 3gstore.com repeater kits now that's all for today and we'll see you next week with another beginner's corner here's a graphic showing a sample of a repeater installation in a house of course your actual installation will vary depending on the equipment you have and where you're installing it you

snippet.title: 3Gstore/EVDOinfo Beginner's Corner: Wireless Repeater Basics
snippet.description: If you need to boost the signal to multiple cellular devices at the same time, or to a device that doesn't have an antenna port, a wireless repeater is the answer!
